instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> is 2 Ohms to ground. Removed <RESISTOR>R7310</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7320</RESISTOR>, and <RESISTOR>R7330</RESISTOR>. Revealed short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> (2 Ohms). Any hope?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
2 ohm is possibly normal value for VCORE; compare with similar board.
Your problem is one of <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>/20/30 chips is burnt.
Need to change all 3 with FDMF6708N from reliable source.
FDMF3030 was also reported on the forum as tested replacement.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I get around 20 Ohms on a good board. 
What do you consider a reliable source for the FDMF6808N chips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Then CPU is dead, stop to waste the time with this board...

BTW, I didn't mention FDMF6808N.
That is Apple proprietary chip, NEVER sold to other!
Of course, you can throw the money buying "NEW" FDMF6808N from chinese sellers...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Ok, thanks. Will assume dead CPU.
